s1.ptxt: Install balancer shafts, balancer bearings and balancer shaft cover to oil pump housing.
Using dial gauge, measure thrust play (axial direction) as shown in figure.

servinfosub.title: Journal out-of-round and taper
servinfosub.ptxt: Using micrometer, measure balancer shaft journal diameter in the directions and at the points shown in figure, and calculate journal out-of-round and taper from measurements.
If measured values exceed their limits, replace corresponding balancer shaft with new one.

s1.ptxt: Clean balancer shaft bearings, balancer shaft journals and bearing sections of both balancers shaft cover and oil pump housing.
Install balancer shafts to oil pump housing.
Place a piece of gauging plastic (1) on the full width of each balancer shaft journal as shown in figure.
Install balancer shaft bearings and balancer shaft cover.
Remove balancer shaft cover and measure each gauging plastic (1) width at its widest point using scale (2) on gauging plastic envelope.
If measured clearance is out of standard, replace balancer shaft bearings with new ones and recheck balancer shaft bearing clearance.
If measured clearance with new bearings is still out of standard, replace corresponding balancer shaft

servinfosub.title: Balancer Shaft Bearing Inspection
servinfosub.ptxt: Check bearings for pitting, scratches, excessive wear or damage. If any detective condition is found, replace balancer shaft bearings.
